issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a default mobile web app and replace the resources directory with the one attached
2. Run the app

Actual result:
The console displays the error "TypeError: Result of expression 'refModule.cjs' [undefined] is not a valid argument for 'in'."

Expected result:
An alert is displayed with the message "Does this app work (YES/NO)? Answer: YES"
fields.summary: MobileWeb : require/include - An error is generated when a .js file is required
fields.environment:
Tested with Ti Studio build 2.0.0.201203132050
Ti Mob SDK 2.0.0.v20120314090311
OSX Lion 10.7.3
iPad 1 OS 4.3.5, Galaxy Tab 10.1 OS 3.0
